questions.question: Patterns can’t be made for which of the following material?

questions.question: When is the wooden pattern considered dry?

explanations.a: Wooden patterns are considered dry when their moisture content is less than 15% because at this moisture level, the wood has stabilized and is less likely to warp, distort, or introduce defects into the casting process due to moisture-related changes.
